New Records: Litton Das smashes a 21-ball 50, the fastest 50 for Bangladesh in T20Is
Virat Kohli becomes the leading run scorer in the history of T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: India defeat Bangladesh by 5 runs (D/L method)
Virat Kohli scores an unbeaten 64 off 44 deliveries
Liton Das top-scores for Bangladesh with a 27-ball 60
Arshdeep Singh picks up two wickets for India
Hasan Mahmud takes 3 wickets for Bangladesh
Pre-Game Insights: Dinesh Karthik is likely to miss the match due to a back spasm, Rishabh Pant is expected to replace him
KL Rahul is expected to retain his place in the playing XI
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expresses happiness with his performance, saying he is in a happy place and loves playing at the Adelaide Oval
KL Rahul says he was relieved to come good with a half-century after a tough patch
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was affected by rain, with the Bangladesh innings being reduced to 16 overs
India's target was revised to 151 runs in 16 overs
The Indian team's recent record of defending targets has been poor, with four losses in seven matches
